posts_data.title: Weirdo Canyon Dispatch Daily Fanzine 2021 â€“ Friday Issue Now Available!
posts_data.content:
If you thought a year without being at Roadburn in Tilburg would mean a year without our daily zine - you're dead wrong!


Weirdo Canyon Dispatch Issue No. 1 is out now! Whether you want to print it out or just dive-deep into our interview with Neptunian Maximalism and our special welcome to the world of Roadburn Redux right on your screen, we've got you covered.

Issues will be out each day and available all weekend -- links in the sidebar -- with exclusive interviews, album-of-the-year-so-far picks, thoughts on a year without live music and photos from the performances at 013 this year as well as from the past. Don't forget Weirdo Canyon Dispatch past and present is archived at weirdocanyondispatch.com, thanks for reading, and enjoy issue 1!

posts_data.title: Roadburn Redux Podcast with Metal Matters - Friday
posts_data.content:
We teamed up with Metal Matters podcast AKA journalist Fred Pessaro and Uniform's Mike Berdan to bring you a special Roadburn podcast every day over this weekend. This should ease you into the first full day of Roadburn Redux...

In today's episode we have two extended conversations with Aaron Turner (Sumac, Old Man Gloom, Mammifer, ex-ISIS etc) and LA's Youth Code, discussing playing in odd spaces, Roadburn memories and why the Anthrax/Public Enemy collaboration was a key step toward musical world peace. In addition, stick around for discussion with Robin Staps of The Ocean / Pelagic Records, Nathan of Witch Mountain and more!


Here's the full pod line up!

Nadja

Aaron Turner

Witch Mountain

Youth Code

Pelagic Records

Lingua Ignota


Follow Metal Matters on Twitter HERE - and subscribe to them wherever you get your podcasts.

posts_data.title: The Quest For Infinity Pt.1
posts_data.content:
Whether it's your pre-party, after-party or just two hours to escape your brain and explore the cosmic reaches, let our special SIX-HOUR-LONG playlist carry you off to places you've never before been. 

Painstakingly and lovingly compiled (by Roadburn's Essential Sounds contributor, David Elouvre) and broken into three two-hour sections, it pushes beyond loud guitars into new realms of psykraut synth, taking the legacy of those who've come before and redefining space as we know it.


Dive in to Part 1...

posts_data.title: Thursday Recap
posts_data.content:
Phew! We've got the first evening done and dusted! Hopefully that's eased you into your Roadburn experience nicely... But if you still want more, hit that button along the top that says The Pit Stop, join us in the weird and wonderful world that Bramble has helped us create so you can interact with fellow 'burners!

We had a little wobble with the chat function here and the site for a second earlier, but all seems to be well now. A huge thank you to everyone who has joined us so far, and to those of you who have donated! If you'd like to make a donation, you'll find the button to do so on the top right of the page.

If you're just joining us now, here's what's ready and waiting for you to catch up on...

  • Kairon; IRSE!
  • Noctule
  • Drowse
  • An Autumn For Crippled Children
  • TAU
  • Alora Crucible

Plus a couple of articles to give you something to get your brain whirring!

What's been your highlight so far?
